content.text:
# Draft:Zhang Xiyuan (warlord)

Zhang Xiyuan (1870â€“1941), courtesy name Gumin, was a Chinese warlord of the Zhili Clique. He was born in Miyun District, Beijing.
Life
Zhang Xiyuan graduated at the Shanhaiguan Military Academy. In 1911, he served as the 58th standard of the 29th Mixed Associatino of thhe Henan New Army. That October, he participated in the suppression of the Wuchang Uprising, that started the Xinhai Revolution.
In 1917, he served as the commander of the 4th Mixed Brigade. In 1918, he fought against the Shaanxi National Protection Army. In 1921, he became the governor of Tongguan, Shaanxi. In May 1922, he was appointed governor of Chahar. In December 1924, following the Beijing Coup that October, he resigned from his post as governor after mounting pressure.
He died in 1941 in the British concession in Tianjin.
